{"step_by_step_thinking": "Septoplasty is a surgical procedure to correct a deviated septum. The middle turbinate is a structure in the nose that can become enlarged (hypertrophy) in response to chronic inflammation or other conditions. This is called compensatory hypertrophy. The goal of septoplasty is to correct the deviated septum, not to change the size of the turbinates. Therefore, septoplasty should not directly change the dimensions of compensatory hypertrophy of the middle turbinate.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
